issue.title: [CF 1112] Same debuff on many players at the same time
issue.body:
Hello,

I'm using TWM 5.0.2.
I want to know how to view the names of players affected by the same debuff at the same time.

Example:

[raid]: <debuff1> on <player1>
[raid]: <debuff1> on <player2>

I don't know if the addon can handle this.

Thanks.


> Posted by CurseForge user akreem | Imported from CurseForge issue #1112 | Raw

comments.body:
You were a little vague in what you're asking. Are you wanting icons that display each the debuff on each person? Then make a buff/debuff icon on the first icon in a group (i.e. iconID 1), and then set it as the group's controller (at the top of the icon editor). Configure it as needed to track the debuff you want on the units you want.

If you only need text output when the debuff is applied, use a Combat Event icon configured to watch for the Aura Applied event, with "raid" as a destination filter. Use the Combat Event trigger for your text notification.

You can't do this with TMW 5.0.2, though. You will definitely need to upgrade - that version is over three years old.

Edited Apr 26, 2015

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Let's take an example:

I want to show the names of the players affected by a debuff from a boss (like Ultraxion) at the same time, like that :

``` [raid]: <Fading Light> on <Jack> and <Paul> ```

Also, i want to show the time remaining of the debuff :

``` [raid]: <Fading Light> on <Jack> and <Paul> : 6/6 sec [raid]: <Fading Light> on <Jack> and <Paul> : 5/6 sec ... [raid]: <Fading Light> on <Jack> and <Paul> : 1/6 sec ```

Thanks.

Edited May 3, 2015

> Posted by CurseForge user akreem

You can't do this, and you definitely can't do it with version 5.0.2.
